greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of factors, with repetition, in all distinct pairs (a <= b) such that a*b = n.
link: Robert Israel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
example: a(16)=6 because there are three distinct pairs (a <= b) such that a*b = n: the pairs (1,16), (2,8) and (4,4). So the number of factors, with repetition, in all the pairs is equal to 6.
results.author: _Omar E. Pol_, Jun 23 2009
